oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excepts from the diary of Sarah Madison Taylor Johnson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sarah Madison Taylor Johnson wrote sporadically about her family's experiences during the Civil War. In January 1862 her father was to join "Bradford's regiment" as a surgeon. In February a cousin was imprisoned at Ft. Donelson, and in April four local; boys were killed at Corinth (Shiloh?" Her uncle James Taylor was ordered to Ft. Pillow on April 17, 1862. She married Sgt. Robert F. Johnson, Co. D, 7th Tenn. Cav., CSA. The diary has been published in The Taylors of Tabernacle. TSLA has a transcription.
